body:
![screenshot_849](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/571494/803098/f6a04b1c-ede3-11e2-9cfa-94102972c4aa.png)
before: "documentation" not visible.

![screenshot_850](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/571494/803099/fcc1f928-ede3-11e2-8e4f-27ca0a96d605.png)
entering name of directory in the url: it exists and contains all the data.

![screenshot_851](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/571494/803100/009098de-ede4-11e2-8a50-5f09f0353866.png)
going back to the root, "documentation" is showing up.

i found out this also affects the desktop syncing app. the "forgotten" files and directories aren't synced, but are even deleted locally. this is kind of dangerous, i would like to understand what goes wrong here.

@despens thanks for the bug report. do you have log files of the server (owncloud.log) and the syncing client? this is super helpful to debug. it would also be great if you could add all the information mentioned in the issue template: https://github.com/owncloud/core/blob/master/contributing.md 
thanks a lot.
i will try to capture everything next time it happens. where do i find logs of the syncing client?

i can confirm this issue for my system (ubuntu server 12.10, oc 5.0.6, linuc client 1.3.0), working mostly with file sync via the client. i recognised when browsing through my mp3 collection and funny enough it seems to affect certain files/directories predominantly.

![bildschirmfoto vom 2013-08-23 09 47 08](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/5292575/1014825/6664b526-0bc8-11e3-9d3e-68d9a475b85a.png)

![bildschirmfoto vom 2013-08-23 09 49 41](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/5292575/1014829/9af3fc98-0bc8-11e3-9aaf-ebfa819fff17.png)

i finally took the time to cross-check data integrity between my server and my client and thew findings were scary. files missing randomly on the client or the server and worst of all sometimes even on both ends (data loss). 

this is not anymore about cloud backup at all. i appreciate all the effort put into making oc more fancy and having more features, but the basic syncing needs to be robust before anyone should think about any gimmicks. 

finally this bug made me switch. i guess oc desperately needs to grow/reduce to a basic maturity.

@modr sorry for the trouble. you can be sure that the developer will fix this bug as soon as possible. unfortunately no one was able so far to reproduce it. can you provide us with the server and cliewnt logs and perhaps a set of file where you can confirm that the error appears. or do you see errors in the webserver/php log file.
basically and information to reproduce this error would be helpful.

thanks a lot.
frank
with server 5.0.11rc1 and desktop client 1.4, all these problems vanished at least for me.
awesome. if someone else still has this problem please comment. otherwise i assume that it's fixed now

i was running into this bug on 5.0.10 and updated to 5.0.11 yesterday. last night all of my directories were showing as expected. this morning they were all gone and i had to manually add them back. 

##server configuration

debian 6.0.7 i386
nginx version: nginx/0.7.67
php 5.4.19-1~dotdeb.0 (fpm-fcgi) (built: aug 24 2013 21:27:04)
mysql  ver 14.14 distrib 5.1.66, for debian-linux-gnu (i486) using readline 6.1

##client information
windows 7 
google chrome 29

i haven't had oc up for long so it is not yet heavily used. please let me know if there are particular log files that would be helpful in debugging this issue. i am happy to provide anything you need.
